title: Troubleshooting Parallel Circuits

pages.notes:
Design values:
   R1 = [sparks.unit.convertMeasurement(r1.nominalResistance + 'Ω')]
   R2 = [sparks.unit.convertMeasurement(r2.nominalResistance + 'Ω')]
   R3 = [sparks.unit.convertMeasurement(r3.nominalResistance + 'Ω')]
   E = 9.00 volts

Unfortunately, the resistance function on your meter is broken, so you can only measure voltage and current.

questions.prompt: The circuit above does not have a short, but one of the resistors is somehow defective. Which of the following describes the defective resistor? (Earn bonus points for fast work!)

options.option: R1 is open[if (r1.resistance<120) {r1.resistance=r1.resistance*10; r1.nominalResistance = r1.nominalResistance*10}; if (r2.resistance<120) {r2.resistance=r2.resistance*10; r2.nominalResistance = r2.nominalResistance*10}; if (r3.resistance<120) {r3.resistance=r3.resistance*10; r3.nominalResistance = r3.nominalResistance*10}; var upval = 13.146; var downval = 0.0735; var rand_case = Math.floor(Math.random()*9); switch (rand_case) { case 0: r1.resistance=1e20; r1.open=true; break; case 1: if (r1.resistance*downval>120){r1.resistance=r1.resistance*downval} else {r1.resistance=r1.resistance*upval}; break; case 2: r1.resistance=r1.resistance*upval; break; case 3: r2.resistance=1e20; r2.open=true; break; case 4: if (r2.resistance*downval>120){r2.resistance=r2.resistance*downval} else {r2.resistance=r2.resistance*upval}; break; case 5: r2.resistance=r2.resistance*upval; break; case 6: r3.resistance=1e20; r3.open=true; break; case 7: if (r3.resistance*downval>120){r3.resistance=r3.resistance*downval} else {r3.resistance=r3.resistance*upval}; break; case 8: r3.resistance=r3.resistance*upval; break; default: break; };  '']

questions.scoring: var badRName = 'Dunno'; var isOpen = ' is open'; var isBig = ' is far too large'; var isSmall = ' is far too small'; var ratioR1 = r1.resistance / r1.nominalResistance; var ratioR2 = r2.resistance / r2.nominalResistance; var ratioR3 = r3.resistance / r3.nominalResistance; var defect = ''; var numVMeasures = log.uniqueVMeasurements(); var numIMeasures = log.uniqueIMeasurements(); /* --- IDENTIFY BAD R --- */ if (r1.open || ratioR1 > 5 || ratioR1 < 0.2) { badRName = 'R1'; } else if (r2.open || ratioR2 > 5 || ratioR2 < 0.2) { badRName = 'R2'; } else if (r3.open || ratioR3 > 5 || ratioR3 < 0.2) { badRName = 'R3'; } if (r1.open || r2.open || r3.open) { defect = 'open'; } else { defect = 'far too '; if (Math.max(ratioR1, ratioR2, ratioR3) > 12) { defect = defect + 'large'; } else { defect = defect + 'small'; } } /* --- SCORE QUESTION --- */ question.correct_answer = badRName + ' is ' + defect; if (question.answer == question.correct_answer && (numVMeasures < 1) && (numIMeasures < 4) && (numIMeasures > 0)) { question.points_earned = 250; question.feedback = 'Bravo! ' + badRName + ' was indeed ' + defect + ' and you did it with amazingly few measurements to earn BONUS points!'; } else if (question.answer == question.correct_answer && (numVMeasures > 1)) { question.points_earned = 150; question.feedback = 'Yes!! ' + badRName + ' was indeed ' + defect + ', but did you learn anything by making all those voltage measurements? You should be able to solve this type problem with only current measurements.'; } else if (question.answer == question.correct_answer && (numIMeasures > 3)) { question.points_earned = 150; question.feedback = 'Yes! ' + badRName + ' was indeed ' + defect + '. Why not try again, and see if you can do it with fewer measurements?'; } else if (question.answer == question.correct_answer && (numIMeasures < 1)) { question.points_earned = 20; question.feedback = 'Well, yes, ' + badRName + ' was indeed ' + defect + ', but current measurements are needed to detect this kind of problem. You earned a few points for being a good guesser!! Try again and earn full points!'; } else if ((question.answer !== question.correct_answer) && ((numIMeasures > 1) || (numVMeasures > 1))) { question.points_earned = 0; question.feedback = 'Sorry, but ' + badRName + ' was the bad resistor in this circuit. Check the tutorial for some tips on measuring parallel circuits.'; } else { question.points_earned = 0; question.feedback = 'You must make some measurements to find the defective resistor. Check the tutorial for some tips on measuring parallel circuits.'; }

COMMENT: 400 pts: 150 pts to identify fault; 150 pts for < 120 sec; 100 pts for few meas.
